node.title: Aussie Parker wins gold at World Triathlon Para Championships
node.alt: An Australian female athlete holds a World Triathlon Para Championships gold medal while next to two supporters.
node.description: Paralympic silver medallist Lauren Parker becomesÂ just the fifth Australian to successfully defend a world paratriathlon championship, with a stunning victory in Abu Dhabi.
node.content: ["Paralympic silver medallist Lauren Parker has become just the fifth Australian to successfully defend a world paratriathlon championship, with a stunning victory in Abu Dhabi.", "Parker scored an impressive win in her PTWC classification at the\u00a0World Triathlon Para Championships around the Abu Dhabi Formula 1 circuit, to take the gold medal by almost four minutes.", "The\u00a032-year-old's\u00a0win came just months after she was pipped for gold by Kendall Gretsch of the United States in a dramatic finish at the Tokyo Paralympic Games.", "But with\u00a0Gretsch back in the US preparing for her second Winter Paralympic Games in Nordic skiing, Parker dominated the Abu Dhabi race.", "Racing to her strengths, Parker opened up a commanding lead on the 750-metre swim and was never headed.", "She covered the swim leg in 11 minutes and 36 seconds \u2014 some 10 seconds faster than her Tokyo swim \u2014\u00a0before powering through the bike and run legs to claim victory in 1:05.24.", "Brazilian\u00a0rising star Jessica Ferreira (1:09.19) was second, with Spain's Tokyo bronze medallist Eva Maria Pedrero (1:11.36) finishing third.", "Parker joins Bill Chaffey, Sally Pilbeam, Katie Kelly and Emily Tapp as Australians to successfully defend a paratriathlon world/grand final crown, having won her first title in Rotterdam in 2019.", "In the Elite World Triathlon Series event in Abu Dhabi, NSW's Natalie Van Coevorden finished 20th in the women's race and the Gold Coast's Brandon Copeland came 28th in the men's category.", "AAP/ABC"]
